member.name: T:WFTools.Services.Batching.Ado.AdoWorkBatchService
member.summary:
Implementation of that provides shared connection support for other ADO-based services. This prevents MSDTC being used in situations where two services share the same connection string.
In addition it also supports using local transactions in databases that do not currently support promotable single phase enlistment. This prevents MSDTC becoming involved when only a single connection is in use.
Although this service allows the sharing of connections where two or more services share a connection string, it does not prevent services from registering with different connection strings. By doing so we can support services that access many databases and still allow them to share existing connections where possible.

member.name: M:WFTools.Services.Batching.Ado.AdoWorkBatchService.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new .
member.remarks: Use this overload if your database supports promotable single phase enlistments (PSPE) or if you intend to use multiple connections in your workflow services. This overload will use distributed transactions where necessary.

member.name: M:WFTools.Services.Batching.Ado.AdoWorkBatchService.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new and register an to prevent promotion to a distributed transaction.
member.param: Indicates whether to use local transactions, preventing promotion to a distributed transaction.
member.remarks: This overload should only be used when one connection (i.e. same connection string) is shared by multiple services *AND* the ADO provider does not support the use of promotable single phase enlistments. Examples include Oracle and SQL Server 2000.

member.name: T:WFTools.Services.Batching.Ado.AdoWorkBatchService.SinglePhaseOnlyTransactionAdapter
member.summary:
Implementation of that prevents a from promoting a local transaction into a distributed transaction.
This allows us to avoid the use of distributed transactions in situtations where we're connecting to databases that do not support promotable single phase enlistment (PSPE) such as Oracle and SQL 2000.
